title: Gov’t wants to table  bill with consultation: Aqeel
content:
ISLAMABAD, Sep 15 (APP):Advisor to the Prime Minister on Legal Affairs, Barrister Aqeel Malik, said on Sunday that the government’s intention was to bring all the allies on board before tabling the bill in the lower and upper houses.
Talking to a private news channel, he said that although the government got the desired numbers needed for the Judicial reforms bill.
He said that all the political forces were taking on board over the proposal of the constitutional amendment.
The consultations with the ally’s parties were underway to bring boarder consensus regarding the bill, he added.
Access to justice is clearly emphasized in the democracy, and our objective is to prioritize the interests of the masses, he further added.
